pullRequest.body:
This PR defines a function that takes a reflexive module `M` equipped with a bilinear form over a commutative ring, and produces a root pairing whose weight space is `M` and whose roots are the reflective vectors.  This is a generalization of the standard construction of root systems from integral lattices.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Looks like this got dropped because of a bors crash

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10919561342/job/30307478273)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10919561342/job/30307477940)

Just a few small nitpicks. Thanks for all your patience, with review: it's quite exciting to see the root system theory growing at such a healthy pace :)

bors d+

How about:
```suggestion
structure IsReflective (B : M →ₗ[R] M →ₗ[R] R) (x : M) : Prop :=
  regular : IsRegular (B x x)
  dvd_two_mul : ∀ y, B x x ∣ 2 * B x y
```

I also think we should use `variable` to save a few characters
```lean
variable (B : M →ₗ[R] M →ₗ[R] R) (x : M)
```
and maybe also add
```lean
lemma isReflective_of_dvd_two [IsDomain R] [NeZero (2 : R)] (x : M) (hx : B x x ∣ 2) :
    IsReflective B x where
  regular := isRegular_of_ne_zero <| fun contra ↦ by simp [contra, two_ne_zero (α := R)] at hx
  dvd_two_mul y := hx.mul_right (B x y)
```

I think we should place the `IsReflective` definition inside the `LinearMap` namespace:
```suggestion
namespace LinearMap
```
and then all the other results except for the main construction of a root pairing should go in the namespace `LinearMap.IsReflective`
and then we can drop a lot of the `of_reflective` (or `of_IsReflective`) suffixes in the naming.

```suggestion

namespace IsReflective

```

```suggestion

end IsReflective

end LinearMap

namespace RootPairing

```

How about here we add:
```suggestion

variable (hx : IsReflective B x)

```
and tidy up as appropriate below

If we're inside `LinearMap.IsReflective` then I think this can be just:
```suggestion
def coroot (hx : IsReflective B x) :
```

I think we should capture the `B x x * ` part of the statement in the name:
```suggestion
lemma mul_coroot_apply {y : M} (hx : IsReflective B x) :
```
(or even `apply_self_mul_coroot_apply`)
oops I forgot to do this one.  (will change soon)

Maybe also worth having:
```suggestion

@[simp]
lemma smul_coroot :
    B x x • coroot B hx = 2 • B x := by
  ext y
  simp only [LinearMap.smul_apply, smul_eq_mul, nsmul_eq_mul, Nat.cast_ofNat]
  exact (hx.dvd_two_mul y).choose_spec.symm

```

```suggestion
    B x x * coroot B hx y = 2 * B x y :=
  (hx.dvd_two_mul y).choose_spec.symm
```

```suggestion
    coroot B hx x = 2 :=
  hx.regular.left <| by simp [mul_comm _ (B x x)]
```

I don't think we need this lemma at all (it's just a very special case of `Module.reflection_apply`):
```suggestion
```
I confirmed your proofs all go through if you replace references to it with just `Module.reflection_apply`

I think it would be nice to state this using the language of orthogonal linear transformations. To my surprise we do not seem to have a definition for these (except possibly in the specialised setting of `InnerProductSpace`).

What do you think about adding something like this somewhere in `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.SesquilinearForm`:
```lean
variable {R M : Type*} [CommRing R] [AddCommGroup M] [Module R M]
  (B : LinearMap.BilinForm R M) (f : Module.End R M)

def LinearMap.IsOrthogonal : Prop :=
  ∀ x y, B (f x) (f y) = B x y

variable {B f}

@[simp]
lemma LinearEquiv.isAdjointPair_symm_iff {f : M ≃ₗ[R] M} :
    LinearMap.IsAdjointPair B B f f.symm ↔ B.IsOrthogonal f :=
  ⟨fun hf x y ↦ by simpa using hf x (f y), fun hf x y ↦ by simpa using hf x (f.symm y)⟩

lemma LinearMap.isOrthogonal_of_forall_apply_same
    (h : IsLeftRegular (2 : R)) (hB : B.IsSymm) (hf : ∀ x, B (f x) (f x) = B x x) :
    B.IsOrthogonal f := by
  intro x y
  suffices 2 * B (f x) (f y) = 2 * B x y from h this
  -- Would this be better as a `calc` proof? (not sure)
  have := hf (x + y)
  simp only [map_add, add_apply, hf x, hf y, hB.eq (f y), hB.eq y] at this
  simp only [add_assoc, add_right_inj] at this
  simp only [← add_assoc, add_left_inj] at this
  simpa only [← two_mul] using this
```
and then using it to state this lemma as:
```suggestion
lemma isOrthogonal_reflection (B : M →ₗ[R] M →ₗ[R] R) (hSB : B.IsSymm)
    {x : M} (hx : IsReflective B x) :
    B.IsOrthogonal (Module.reflection (corootOfIsReflective_apply_self B hx)) := by
```

We can drop `B` here. I also think it's OK to shorten the name here since we're already in the namespace:
```suggestion
lemma reflective_reflection (hSB : LinearMap.IsSymm B) {x y : M}
```

I think we should drop this:
```suggestion
```
and instead add the following just below the definition of `IsReflexive.toPerfectPairingDual` in `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.PerfectPairing`:
```lean
@[simp]
lemma IsReflexive.toPerfectPairingDual_apply {f : Dual R M} {x : M} :
    IsReflexive.toPerfectPairingDual (R := R) f x = f x :=
  rfl
```

```suggestion
    { toFun := fun x => IsReflective.coroot B x.2
```
(and +2 spaces indentation below as a result)

```suggestion
  root_coroot_two x := by
```

```suggestion
  reflection_perm_root x y := by
```

```suggestion
  reflection_perm_coroot x y := by
```

```suggestion
  reflection_perm x :=
```

Fully qualifying makes our docs links work:
```suggestion
 * `LinearMap.IsReflective`: Length is a regular value of `R`, and reflection is definable.
 * `LinearMap.IsReflective.coroot`: The coroot corresponding to a reflective vector.
 * `RootPairing.ofBilinear`: The root pairing whose roots are reflective vectors.
```

```suggestion
lemma _root_.LinearEquiv.isAdjointPair_symm_iff {f : M ≃ₗ[R] M} :
```
